message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) field of Computer Science, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv. The paper focuses on automated summarization of Electronic Health Record (EHR) discharge notes, which involves processing and analyzing large amounts of unstructured text data. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers research on NLP and its applications. 

The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques to extract relevant information from the EHR notes, which suggests that cs.IR (Information Retrieval) could be another relevant sub-category. 

The use of machine learning models, specifically LSTM, to label topics in the EHR notes indicates that the paper could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Finally, the paper deals with healthcare data, which is a sensitive and regulated domain, and involves privacy and security concerns. This suggests that cs.CY (Computers and Society) could also be a relevant sub-category.
